main_definition: Encoding refers to the process of converting information into a specific format or code that can be easily stored, transmitted, or understood.

meanings_and_examples.example: When you type a letter on your keyboard, it is encoded into binary data for the computer to understand.
A radio station encodes its broadcasts so that they can be transmitted and received by radios across cities or countries.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Secret language used for covert communication
meanings_and_examples.example: Spies may use encoded messages to communicate sensitive information without others understanding the content.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The conversion of sound into electrical signals in audio technology
meanings_and_examples.example: An analog-to-digital converter encodes an analog sound signal into a digital format for processing or storage.
